question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Strengthened ability and endurance to read Greek prose. Ability to recognise patterns and words in context. More familiarity with grammatical forms. Good survey of imperial greek prose fiction.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
This was a remarkably engaging and thought-provoking class. I had a chance to improve my Greek comprehension skills and was considerably more comfortably with sight reading in Greek by the end of semester. I also got to practice my Greek composition and grammar and managed to improve my language competence overall.
But what made this class so stimulating was its content: Greek novel and Lucian are very engaging subjects and as we covered the course materials numerous relevant and interesting themes came up. We discussed the implications of the genre of the novel, the social and gender issues, the symbolism, rhetorical program, and even considerable deal of philosophy! And the course structure facilitated a healthy, supportive, and enjoyable learning atmosphere.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
1.  Grammar contructions used by Lucian
2. Metaphors and figurative language
3. Greek imperial works

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: Improved Greek composition, increased knowledge of the genre of Greek novel, improved understanding of grammar

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: More difficult/detailed looks into Greek grammar after learning the fundamentals in previous courses, connecting the readings to Greek cultural/mythological references, Greek composition and vocabulary specific to Lucian's True History.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I continued to learn about reading Greek, this time reading in large chunks of prose (chapters). I learned about “deep cuts” in the Greek world: the travel/romance novel is an under studied field in classics! I also learned about different approaches to scholarly writing in classics.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Good learning environment with not that many students. Ability to ask many questions. Manageable work load and well-spaced exams.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text:
Professor Weiberg is one of the most outstanding teachers I have ever had. She genuinely enjoys teaching and values the learning for the sake of learning. I can safely say and each and every one of her students has felt accommodated and welcomed. She has never hesitated to explain course material multiple times and assist me in ways that were beyond her responsibilities. 
The course had a structure that is very conducive to both learning and critical thinking. It had numerous components and helped us improve our Greek from different angles, as well as develop fresh and critical perspectives on the subject.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I love Weiberg's teaching style, and the course overall offers many learning opportunities. I loved the composition exercises as well!

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Specifications grading was excellent, my stress in the class was greatly reduced by this grading style and I was able to focus exclusively on learning the material. The class reading was well developed and easy to follow along with. The teaching style was low stress and easy to keep up with. Assignments were well thought out and very manageable.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructor and the course facilitated my learning because the (really unique) grading scheme was built around a comprehensive understanding of the work from all angles — including composition, which is something that I've never touched in my other courses. The class was also taught in a way that encouraged participation from everyone and invited all perspectives, which was helpful for me because I got to hear everyone's takes.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The S/U grading system is a really really good way of taking stress off students while encouraging language learning. It lets you put time and effort into your work and demonstrate what you’ve learned without the pressure of getting a bad grade. It lets your performance reflect your effort.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: Small class size and amicable professor who is easy to talk to and happy to take time to help you.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The interaction with the material, Weiberg's engagement, and the analysis of the material was engaging! I also enjoyed the collaborative elements of this class.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: The text chosen for the class was interesting and the assignments were challenging but interesting and not overwhelming.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: I loved the discussions and how I could pose questions to the class when I had them — I'm generally pretty withdrawn in my other courses, but I think Dr. Weiberg consciously tried to make this an environment where someone could say what they thought without feeling like they had a silly question.

question_text: What made this class stimulating or how could it be more intellectually stimulating if it wasn’t?
response_text: After a while, getting a feel for one author’s writing and reading chapters at a time meant that my reading started flowing and I got to engage more, stopping for vocab less and getting a better sense of Lucian’s narrative personality. Prof Weiberg should definitely be considered for tenure!!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take this course, it is very manageable as opposed to Greek drama or poetry

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I highly recommend this course. You will improve your Greek, learn a lot about the genre of Greek imperial fiction, and will have lots of fun as well!

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take a class with Weiberg! Thay want you to succeed.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Absolutely take this class. Greek novel as a genre is really entertaining, and Professor Weiberg is fantastic. They consistently deliver stellar instruction without overburdening students and the course is very easy to keep up with and manage amongst other classes.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Banger! Take it. Dr. Weiberg is very accessible and inviting, and the size of the class (although this might be a classics major thing) really helped facilitate a collaborative atmosphere.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Take it! It’s low stress, high engagement, and will challenge you in the best way.
